cards.name: Ancient Tomb
cards.text: {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool. Ancient Tomb deals 2 damage to you.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool. Ancient Tomb deals 2 damage to you.
cards.flavor:
There is no glory to be gained in the kingdom of the dead.

—Vec tomb inscription

cards.name: Boseiju, Who Shelters All
cards.text:
Boseiju, Who Shelters All enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}, Pay 2 life: Add {1} to your mana pool. If that mana is spent on an instant or sorcery spell, that spell can't be countered by spells or abilities.
cards.originalText:
Boseiju, Who Shelters All enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}, Pay 2 life: Add {1} to your mana pool. If that mana is spent on an instant or sorcery spell, that spell can't be countered by spells or abilities.

rulings.text: The spell can't be countered if the mana produced by Boseiju is spent to cover any cost of the spell, even an additional cost such as a splice cost. This is true even if you pay an additional cost while casting a spell "without paying its mana cost."
Suppose mana produced by Boseiju is spent on a spell and an effect creates a copy of that spell. The copy can be countered, even though the original can't.

foreignNames.name: すべてを護るもの、母聖樹
Boseiju, la que cobija a todos

cards.name: Cephalid Coliseum
cards.text:
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool. Cephalid Coliseum deals 1 damage to you.

Threshold — {U}, {T}, Sacrifice Cephalid Coliseum: Target player draws three cards, then discards three cards. Activate this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool. Cephalid Coliseum deals 1 damage to you.

Threshold — {U}, {T}, Sacrifice Cephalid Coliseum: Target player draws three cards, then discards three cards. Activate this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

cards.name: Desert
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

{T}: Desert deals 1 damage to target attacking creature. Activate this ability only during the end of combat step.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

{T}: Desert deals 1 damage to target attacking creature. Activate this ability only during the end of combat step.

rulings.text: The ability can be used on any player's attacking creatures. This includes your own and creatures in an attack you are not involved in (for multiplayer games).

cards.name: Dryad Arbor
cards.text: (Dryad Arbor isn't a spell, it's affected by summoning sickness, and it has "{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.")

rulings.text: Forest is a land type. Dryad is a creature type.
Dryad Arbor is played as a land. It doesn't use the stack, it's not a spell, it can't be responded to, it has no mana cost, and it counts as your land play for the turn.

If a Dryad Arbor gains flash, or you have the ability to play Dryad Arbor as though it had flash (due to Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir or Scout's Warning, for example), you can ignore the normal timing rules for playing a land, but not any other restrictions. You can't play Dryad Arbor during another player's turn, and you can't play Dryad Arbor if it's your turn and you've already played a land.
If Dryad Arbor is changed into another basic land type (such as by Sea's Claim), it continues to be a creature and a Dryad.

Although originally printed with a characteristic-defining ability that defined its color, this card now has a color indicator. This color indicator can't be affected by text-changing effects (such as the one created by Crystal Spray), although color-changing effects can still overwrite it.

cards.name: Forbidden Orchard
cards.text:
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

Whenever you tap Forbidden Orchard for mana, target opponent puts a 1/1 colorless Spirit creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

Whenever you tap Forbidden Orchard for mana, put a 1/1 colorless Spirit creature token onto the battlefield under target opponent's control.

cards.name: Glacial Chasm
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep—Pay 2 life. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

When Glacial Chasm enters the battlefield, sacrifice a land.

Creatures you control can't attack.

Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you.
cards.originalText:
Cumulative upkeep—Pay 2 life.

When Glacial Chasm enters the battlefield, sacrifice a land.

Creatures you control can't attack.

Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you.

rulings.text: When Glacial Chasm's enters-the-battlefield ability resolves, if you don't control any other lands, you must sacrifice Glacial Chasm itself.

cards.name: Grove of the Burnwillows
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool. Each opponent gains 1 life.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool. Each opponent gains 1 life.
cards.flavor: Spring is the most beautiful season in the grove, when the new leaves open from their ember-buds in a race of leaping flames.

cards.name: High Market
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

{T}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain 1 life.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

{T}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: If it can't be had here, it can't be had on any world.

cards.name: Maze of Ith
cards.text: {T}: Untap target attacking creature. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.
cards.originalText: {T}: Untap target attacking creature. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.

rulings.text: Can target an untapped attacking creature. Both parts of the effect will try to happen even if one part does nothing useful. So if it tries to untap an already untapped card, it will still make the creature neither deal nor receive damage.
The creature is still part of the combat. It just has its damage prevented. Don't infer something from the fact that it becomes untapped.

cards.name: Murmuring Bosk
cards.text:
({T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.)

As Murmuring Bosk enters the battlefield, you may reveal a Treefolk card from your hand. If you don't, Murmuring Bosk enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool. Murmuring Bosk deals 1 damage to you.
cards.originalText:
({T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.)

As Murmuring Bosk enters the battlefield, you may reveal a Treefolk card from your hand. If you don't, Murmuring Bosk enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool. Murmuring Bosk deals 1 damage to you.

rulings.text: Murmuring Bosk is a Forest, but it isn't a basic land. Things that affect basic lands don't affect it. Things that affect basic land types do. For example, you can't find Murmuring Bosk with Fertilid's ability ("searches his or her library for a basic land card"), but you can find Murmuring Bosk with Everbark Shaman's ability ("search your library for two Forest cards").

cards.name: Shivan Gorge
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

{2}{R}, {T}: Shivan Gorge deals 1 damage to each opponent.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

{2}{R}, {T}: Shivan Gorge deals 1 damage to each opponent.

rulings.text: The damage has no color. It is not red.

cards.name: Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth
cards.text: Each land is a Swamp in addition to its other land types.
cards.originalText: Each land is a Swamp in addition to its other land types.
cards.flavor:
"Yawgmoth's corpse is a wound in the universe. His foul blood seeps out, infecting the land with his final curse."

—Lord Windgrace

rulings.text: Urborg is not a Swamp while it's not on the battlefield.
While it is on the battlefield, Urborg is a Swamp and thus has the ability "{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool."

If Urborg loses its abilities (for example, it becomes a creature and then Ovinize is cast on it), all lands on the battlefield, including Urborg, will still be Swamps, but Urborg won't have the ability "Each land is a Swamp in addition to its other land types." Urborg also won't be able to tap to produce {B}, but other lands (including those that enter the battlefield later in the turn) will. The way continuous effects work, Urborg's type-changing ability is applied before Ovinize removes both the type-changing ability and its own mana ability.
This is not the same card as the legendary land Urborg from the Legends set.  Both of them can be on the battlefield at the same time.

If Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth and either Blood Moon or Magus of the Moon are on the battlefield, all nonbasic lands will be Mountains, not Swamps. Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth will be a Mountain as well. It will have "{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool" and no other abilities.

foreignNames.name: 约格莫夫之墓乌尔博格
約格莫夫之墓烏爾博格
ヨーグモスの墳墓、アーボーグ

cards.name: Vesuva
cards.text: You may have Vesuva enter the battlefield tapped as a copy of any land on the battlefield.
cards.originalText: You may have Vesuva enter the battlefield tapped as a copy of any land on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: It is everywhere you've ever been.

rulings.text: Vesuva has no intrinsic mana abilities.
If you don't choose a land on the battlefield, Vesuva enters the battlefield untapped as itself.
Cornered Market won't prevent Vesuva from being played (unless there's a Vesuva on the battlefield copying nothing), since you play it before it becomes named something else.

cards.name: Windbrisk Heights
cards.text:
Hideaway (This land enters the battlefield tapped. When it does, look at the top four cards of your library, exile one face down, then put the rest on the bottom of your library.)

{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

{W}, {T}: You may play the exiled card without paying its mana cost if you attacked with three or more creatures this turn.
cards.originalText:
Hideaway (This land enters the battlefield tapped. When it does, look at the top four cards of your library, exile one face down, then put the rest on the bottom of your library.)

{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

{W}, {T}: You may play the exiled card without paying its mana cost if you attacked with three or more creatures this turn.

rulings.text: At the time the ability resolves, you'll get to play the card if you declared three different creatures as attackers at any point in the turn. A creature declared as an attacker in two different attack phases counts only once. A creature that entered the battlefield attacking (such as a token created by Militia's Pride) doesn't count because you never attacked with it.
